result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Randy Scott Reifschneider in court.  Attorney Thomas J McClure Esq in court for Randy Scott Reifschneider.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. CASES CALLED:  21CF435 & 22CF42.  Cases are resolved - counsel req plea be entered and sentencing adj.  State is in compliance w/victims rights.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 1 in 21CF435 & Ct 1 in 22CF42.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 2 in 21CF435 & Ct 2 in 22CF42.  Court finds def guilty and orders presentence investigation be prepared.  Court revokes bond and remands def to jail pending sentencing.  JT set to begin 9-19-22 removed from the calendar.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears in person and without counsel.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State requests $10,000 cash bond.  Motion for joinder pending with Branch 4 case 21CF435 set for oral ruling on 4-15-2022.  $2,500 cash bond set.  Matter set for oral ruling in Branch 4 and that date to remain.
